Definition: Collector's sample name. Mandatory.
Additional instructions: Must be unique in a sample set

Definition: Leave blank if you want SESAR to assign the IGSN.
Leave blank if a parent IGSN does not exist.
Date when sample metadata is publicly accessible and searchable. If null, defaults to date of registration (recommended).
Additional instructions: SESAR recommends that sample metadata become public within 2 years of sample registration.

Definition: Material that the sample consists of. Mandatory.
Additional instructions: Please use controlled list

Definition: More descriptive Object Type. This applies only to samples with Object Type set to Individual Sample.
Additional instructions: Please use controlled list

Definition: Taxonomy (formal classification) Formal categorization of sample.
Additional instructions: Please use controlled list (for Rocks), Please use controlled list (for Minerals)

Definition: Taxonomy (field name) Informal classification of sample.
Other name(s) used for the sample.
Additional instructions: Provide multiple other names in a semi-colon delimited fashion.

Example: dredge with 50 pieces of basalt and mud
Definition: Free text to describe features of a sample such as its components, texture, color, shape, etc.
Numerical value for the minimum age of a sample
Additional instructions: Must be a number

Definition: Numerical value for the maximum age of a sample
Additional instructions: Must be a number

Definition: Unit for the age provided
Age of a sample as described by the stratigraphic era, period, state, etc.
A body of rock established as a distinct entity in the classification of the Earth's rocks, e.g. Supergroup, Group, Formation, or Flow
Method by which a sample was collected
Additional instructions: Suggested list

Example: Hand sample collected from the top part of a large boulder
Definition: Additional information about the collection method
Size of the registered object, such as the dimension of a specimen, the length of a core, or the weight of a dredge
Unit for the numerical value provided for 'size'.
Latitude of the location where the sample was collected. ('Start latitude' for linear sampling features such as dredges.) Needs to be entered in decimal degrees. Negative values for South latitudes.
Additional instructions: Please supply no more than 6 decimal places (meter scale resolution) in the actual number (not just display format.) No letters are allowed.

Definition: End latitude of the location where the sample was collected.
Additional instructions: Please supply no more than 6 decimal places (meter scale resolution) in the actual number (not just display format.) No letters are allowed.

Definition: Longitude of the location where the sample was collected. ('Start longitude' for linear sampling features such as dredges.) Needs to be entered in decimal degrees. Negative values for 'West' longitudes.
Additional instructions: Please supply no more than 6 decimal places (meter scale resolution) in the actual number (not just display format.) No letters are allowed.

Definition: End longitude of the location where the sample was collected.
Additional instructions: Please supply no more than 6 decimal places (meter scale resolution) in the actual number (not just display format.) No letters are allowed.

Definition: Geographic Cartesian coordinate of where the sample was collected, in meters, as in UTM. "4111279"
Additional instructions: To be geolocated in the SESAR system, latitude and longitude must be filled out. UTM coordinates can be specified for reference but will not place the sample on the map. There are several web tools for converting from UTM to latitude/longitude, such as http://www.earthpoint.us/Convert.aspx.

Definition: Geographic Cartesian coordinate of where the sample was collected, in meters, as in UTM. "305294"
Additional instructions: To be geolocated in the SESAR system, latitude and longitude must be filled out. UTM coordinates can be specified for reference but will not place the sample on the map. There are several web tools for converting from UTM to latitude/longitude, such as http://www.earthpoint.us/Convert.aspx.

Definition: Zone for the geographic Cartesian coordinate "11R"
Additional instructions: UTM zone, use a number from 1 to 60, followed by a letter between A and Z to specify UTM zone with no spaces in between. Letter must be capitalized.

Definition: Vertical datum used to calculate the elevation
Elevation at which a sample was collected. Use negative values for depth below sea level. Minimum elevation if a range is provided for the elevation/depth below sea level.
Elevation at which a sample was collected. Use negative values for depth below sea level. Maximum elevation if a range is provided for the elevation/depth below sea level.
Unit in which elevation start and/or end are provided in.
Additional instructions: Must be one of the following: meters, feet, miles, kilometers

Definition: Navigation type
Additional instructions: Please use controlled list

Definition: Type of physical feature that your sample was collected from
Additional instructions: Suggested list

Definition: Name of the physiographic feature that you entered
Free text description of the location

Example: Franklin Mine; Craters of the Moon National Park
Definition: Name of the specific place where your sample was collected. This could be the name of a mine, a volcanic field, a vent field, or similar
Additional information about the specific place where your sample was collected
Country where the sample was collected
Additional instructions: Please use controlled list

Definition: State or Province where the sample was collected
County where the sample was collected
City or Township where the sample was collected
Name or identifier of the field program (cruise or expedition), during which the sample was collected
Additional instructions: For ship cruises, we recommended using the R2R Cruise ID at http://www.rvdata.us/catalog

Definition: Type of platform for the cruise.
Additional instructions: Suggested list

Definition: Name of platform for the cruise.
The type of launch used to collect the sample.
Additional instructions: Please use controlled list

Definition: The name of the launch used to collect the sample.
Further identifying information about the launch
Name of the person who collected the sample. In case of larger field programs, name of chief scientist responsible for sample collection.

Example: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, Woods Hole, MA
Definition: Institution, address, & email of the collector or chief scientist.
Date when the sample was collected.
Additional instructions: YYYY-MM-DD: for best results, format this column in the spreadsheet as 'Text'. If only the year of collection is known, please enter, for example, 2015-01-01 and specify 'year' as the Collection date precision.

Definition: Time when the sample was collected.
Additional instructions: HH:MM:SSZ, format this column in the spreadsheet as 'Text'. If 'Z' is not specified, United States Eastern Time is assumed.

Definition: Date when the sample collection was finished (if a date range is provided).
Additional instructions: YYYY-MM-DD: for best results, format this column in the spreadsheet as 'Text'

Definition: Time when the sample was collected.
Additional instructions: HH:MM:SSZ, format this column in the spreadsheet as 'Text'. If 'Z' is not specified, United States Eastern Time is assumed.

Definition: Precision to display the collection date and time.

Example: Lamont Deep Sea Core Repository; Palisades, NY
Definition: Name of institution, museum, or repository where the sample is currently stored.
Address and/or email of the person who should be contacted for information about or access to the sample.
Additional instructions: Email is not mandatory, but helps for communication about samples.

Example: Lamont Deep Sea Core Repository; Palisades, NY
Definition: Name of institution, museum, or repository where the sample was originally stored.
Address and/or email of the person who should be contacted for information about the sample's original archive.
Minimum depth at which a sample was collected from its parent core
Maximum depth at which a sample was collected from its parent core
Unit in which the depth is provided
